title: Who should stand up for human rights? | | Al Jazeera

organizations.name: al jazeera inside story human rights who

text:
Inside Story Human Rights Who should stand up for human rights? Amnesty International says the world has become a darker place, with a rise in 'divisive and dangerous' politics. 22 Feb 2017 21:41 GMT Human Rights 
Amnesty International's latest snapshot of the world paints a picture of darkness, division and danger. 
The human rights watchdog says 2016 was the year of "us versus them" - that governments world-wide are pushing a "toxic agenda that scapegoats and dehumanises people". 
Amnesty blames US President Donald Trump, the Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte and Hungaryâ€™s Prime Minister Viktor Orban. 
The Amnesty report documents abuses and intolerance in almost every country. 
Who should be held to account? 
Presenter: Sami Zeidan
